00016 PulseCandidateFinder::PulseCandidateFinder(std::string detname, modules::options* opts): fChannel(detname) {
00017 
00018   if (fDefaultParameterValues.empty()) {
00019     SetDefaultParameterValues();
00020   }
00021 
00022   fNSigma = opts->GetInt("n_sigma", 0);
00023   if (fNSigma == 0) {
00024     fParameterValue = opts->GetInt(detname, fDefaultParameterValues[fChannel]); // set the parameter value for this channel
00025   }
00026   else {
00027     if (fOneSigmaValues.empty()) {
00028       SetOneSigmaValues();
00029     }
00030     fParameterValue = fNSigma * fOneSigmaValues[IDs::channel(detname)];
00031   }
00032 
00033   if (opts->HasOption("debug") && (opts->GetOption("debug").empty() || opts->GetBool("debug"))) {
00034     std::cout << "Parameter Value for " << fChannel << " PulseCandidateFinder is " << fParameterValue << std::endl; // would be nice to know which module this is for
00035   }
00036 }
00037 
00040 void PulseCandidateFinder::FindPulseCandidates(TPulseIsland* pulse) {
00041 
00042   // Clear the vector of pulse candidate locations first since it will still contain them from previous pulses
00043   fPulseCandidateLocations.clear();
00044 
00045   fPulseIsland = pulse;
00046 
00047   // We have a different algorithm for fast and slow pulses
00048   if (fChannel.isFast()) {
00049     FindCandidatePulses_Fast(fParameterValue);
00050   }
00051   else if (fChannel.isSlow()) {
00052     FindCandidatePulses_Slow(fParameterValue);
00053   }
00054   else {
00055     // this is a scintillator so do the fast pulse analysis
00056     FindCandidatePulses_Fast(fParameterValue);
00057   }
00058 }

00060 PulseCandidateFinder::~PulseCandidateFinder() {
00061 }
00062 
00065 std::vector<TPulseIsland*> PulseCandidateFinder::GetPulseCandidates() {
00066 
00067   // Get the output ready
00068   std::vector<TPulseIsland*> pulse_candidates;
00069 
00070   // Loop through the pulse candidate locations
00071   for (std::vector<Location>::iterator locationIter = fPulseCandidateLocations.begin(); locationIter != fPulseCandidateLocations.end(); ++locationIter) {
00072     
00073     // Get the start and stop locations
00074     int start_location = (*locationIter).start;
00075     int stop_location = (*locationIter).stop;
00076 
00077     // Get the bank name and work out what the new timestamp will be
00078     std::string bankname = fPulseIsland->GetBankName();
00079     int new_timestamp = fPulseIsland->GetTimeStamp() + start_location;
00080 
00081     // Get the samples from the original TPI and have a new one ready for the pulse candidate
00082     const std::vector<int>& theSamples = fPulseIsland->GetSamples();
00083     std::vector<int> theNewSamples;
00084 
00085     // Loop through the samples between the start and stop locations and add them to the new samples vector
00086     for (int iSample = start_location; iSample <= stop_location; ++iSample) {
00087       theNewSamples.push_back(theSamples.at(iSample));
00088     }
00089 
00090     TPulseIsland* pulse_island = new TPulseIsland(new_timestamp, theNewSamples, bankname);
00091     pulse_candidates.push_back(pulse_island);
00092   }
00093 
00094   return pulse_candidates;
00095 }
00096 
00099 void PulseCandidateFinder::FindCandidatePulses_Fast(int rise) {
00100 
00101   const std::vector<int>& samples = fPulseIsland->GetSamples();
00102   unsigned int n_samples = samples.size();
00103   int pedestal = fPulseIsland->GetPedestal(0);
00104   int polarity = fPulseIsland->GetTriggerPolarity();
00105 
00106   int s1, s2, ds; // this sample value, the previous sample value and the change in the sample value
00107   bool found = false;
00108   Location location;
00109 
00110   // Loop through the samples
00111   for (unsigned int i = 1; i < n_samples; ++i) {
00112     s1 = polarity * (samples[i-1] - pedestal);
00113     s2 = polarity * (samples[i] - pedestal);
00114     ds = s2 - s1;
00115 
00116     if (found) {
00117       if (s2 < 0) { // stop if the sample goes below pedestal
00118         location.stop = (int)i;
00119         fPulseCandidateLocations.push_back(location);
00120         found = false;
00121       }
00122     } else {
00123       if (ds > rise) {
00124         found = true;
00125         location.start = (int)(i - 1);
00126       }
00127     }
00128   }
00129 }
00130 
00133 void PulseCandidateFinder::FindCandidatePulses_Slow(int threshold) {
00134 
00135   const std::vector<int>& samples = fPulseIsland->GetSamples();
00136   unsigned int n_samples = samples.size();
00137   int pedestal = fPulseIsland->GetPedestal(0);
00138   int polarity = fPulseIsland->GetTriggerPolarity();
00139 
00140   int sample_height; // the sample's height above pedestal
00141   int start, stop; // the start and stop location
00142   bool found = false;
00143   Location location;
00144 
00145   // Loop through the samples
00146   for (unsigned int i = 0; i < n_samples; ++i) {
00147     sample_height = polarity * (samples[i] - pedestal);
00148 
00149     if (found) {
00150       if (sample_height < 0) { // stop if the sample goes below pedestal
00151         location.stop = (int)i;
00152         start = stop = 0;
00153         fPulseCandidateLocations.push_back(location);
00154         found = false;
00155       }
00156     } else {
00157       if (sample_height > threshold) {
00158         found = true;
00159         location.start = (int)(i);
00160       }
00161     }
00162   }
00163 }

00168 void PulseCandidateFinder::FillParameterHistogram(TH1D* histogram) {
00169 
00170   std::string detname = TSetupData::Instance()->GetDetectorName(fPulseIsland->GetBankName());
00171   IDs::channel theChannel = detname;
00172 
00173   std::string parameter_name = "Unknown";
00174 
00175   // We have a different algorithm for fast and slow pulses
00176   if (theChannel.isFast()) {
00177     parameter_name = "SampleDifference";
00178     FillSampleDifferencesHistogram(histogram);
00179   }
00180   else if (theChannel.isSlow()) {
00181     parameter_name = "SampleHeight";
00182     FillSampleHeightsHistogram(histogram);
00183   }
00184   else {
00185     // it's a scintillator so plot the fast parameters
00186     parameter_name = "SampleDifference";
00187     FillSampleDifferencesHistogram(histogram);
00188   }
00189 
00190   std::string histtitle = "Plot of " + parameter_name + " for " + detname + " for Run 2808";
00191   histogram->SetTitle(histtitle.c_str());
00192   histogram->GetYaxis()->SetTitle("");
00193   histogram->GetXaxis()->SetTitle(parameter_name.c_str());
00194 }

00198 void PulseCandidateFinder::FillSampleDifferencesHistogram(TH1D* histogram) {
00199 
00200   const std::vector<int>& samples = fPulseIsland->GetSamples();
00201   unsigned int n_samples = samples.size();
00202   int pedestal = fPulseIsland->GetPedestal(0);
00203   int polarity = fPulseIsland->GetTriggerPolarity();
00204 
00205   int s1, s2, ds; // this sample value, the previous sample value and the change in the sample value
00206 
00207   // Loop through the samples
00208   for (unsigned int i = 1; i < n_samples; ++i) {
00209     s1 = polarity * (samples[i-1] - pedestal);
00210     s2 = polarity * (samples[i] - pedestal);
00211     ds = s2 - s1;
00212 
00213     histogram->Fill(ds);
00214   }
00215 }

00219 void PulseCandidateFinder::FillSampleHeightsHistogram(TH1D* histogram) {
00220 
00221   const std::vector<int>& samples = fPulseIsland->GetSamples();
00222   unsigned int n_samples = samples.size();
00223   int pedestal = fPulseIsland->GetPedestal(0);
00224   int polarity = fPulseIsland->GetTriggerPolarity();
00225 
00226   int sample_height; // the height of this sample above pedestal
00227 
00228   // Loop through the samples
00229   for (unsigned int i = 0; i < n_samples; ++i) {
00230     sample_height = polarity * (samples[i] - pedestal);
00231 
00232     histogram->Fill(sample_height);
00233   }
00234 }

00284 std::map<IDs::channel, double> PulseCandidateFinder::fOneSigmaValues;
00285 
00288 void PulseCandidateFinder::SetOneSigmaValues() {
00289 
00290   // Open the text file
00291   std::ifstream file_in("pedestal-and-noise.txt", std::ifstream::in);
00292 
00293   // The values that we will read in
00294   std::string detname, bankname;
00295   std::string pedestal, noise;
00296 
00297   // Get the SQLite database file
00298   TSQLiteServer* server = new TSQLiteServer("sqlite://pedestals-and-noises.sqlite");
00299 
00300   std::stringstream query; 
00301   std::string tablename = "pedestals_and_noises";
00302   if (server) {
00303 
00304     query << "SELECT * FROM " << tablename << ";"; // get all the pedestals and noises
00305     TSQLiteResult* result = (TSQLiteResult*) server->Query(query.str().c_str());  // get the result of this query
00306     query.str(""); // clear the stringstream after use
00307 
00308     TSQLiteRow* row = (TSQLiteRow*) result->Next(); // get the first row
00309     while (row != NULL) {
00310       //      std::cout << row->GetField(0) << " " << row->GetField(1) << " " << row->GetField(2) << " " << row->GetField(3) << std::endl;
00311       detname = row->GetField(0);
00312       bankname = row->GetField(1);
00313       pedestal = row->GetField(2);
00314       noise = row->GetField(3);
00315 
00316       fOneSigmaValues[IDs::channel(detname)] = atof(noise.c_str());
00317       
00318       delete row;
00319       row = (TSQLiteRow*) result->Next(); // get the next row
00320     }
00321     delete result; // user has to delete the result
00322   }
00323   else {
00324     std::cout << "Error: Couldn't connect to SQLite database" << std::endl;
00325   }
00326 }
